description: Two pairs, each married for quite a long time, are living in a small east German town. The film focuses on the relationships between each of the four people and what happens when an affair takes place between two of them who are not married to each other and logically betraying the two remaining characters. This event leads to deep thoughts about marriage, friendship, relationships and last not least life itself.                Written byBenjamin Stello
title: Grill Point

review.text: Part comedy, part drama, 'Grill Point' gets up close and personal in documentary style with two families in middle class Germany.  The local Radio DJ has an affair with a restauranters wife; we are agonizingly close as the fallout of betrayal and discovery manifests itself.Its not all doom and gloom though; we get comedic moments with an ever-growing street side performance troupe that becomes the thorn in the side; and the adultery itself is handled initially with a playful jocularity that belies what is to come.Let down by not really having a style and sticking to it to maintain consistency; 'Grill Point' is an interesting but flawed drama.
